duties_responsibilities.duty: Inspect materials and products for conformance to specifications using variable, fixed, or preset measuring equipment.
Compare product with parts list, blueprints, specifications, or sample model to ensure completion and correctness of the assembly or subassemblies.
Verify specified dimensions using proper test equipment and procedures.
Identify rejected parts with prescribed methods.
Test products for structural flaws.
Maintain records on all defects and the number of parts rejected.
Use statistical sampling plans when required to conduct inspections.
Assist in training new technicians when required.
Responsible for general housekeeping of the work area.
Interact with customers as required.
Assist engineers during investigations of failures (root cause analysis) as required.
Monitor inspections to ensure compliance of processes and testing required to maintain quality and reliability of products.
Recommend improvements to Quality Assurance processes, QAS's, and manufacturing processes.
Communicate with direct supervisor and PMT groups to make necessary changes of audits/inspections.
Demonstrate independent judgment in defining problems, collecting data, establishing facts, and drawing valid conclusions.
Apply analysis and problem-solving skills to handle daily questions/issues from workers, managers, customers, etc.
Use mathematical concepts such as probability, statistical inference, and fundamentals of plane and solid geometry and trigonometry.
Troubleshoot inspection equipment/instrument interactions using reference materials available (STM, SOP, Operators Manual).
Read and interpret simple instructions, short correspondence, and memos.
Write short correspondence.
Effectively present information in one-on-one and small group situations to customers, clients, and other employees of the organization.
Apply basic computer skills associated with traditional PC-based software such as Microsoft Office and Lotus Notes.
Comprehend and interpret basic measurement techniques including reading scales (rulers).
Read and interpret blueprints, to include discerning specification (in tolerance / out of tolerance) and converting fractions and decimals.
Work with working knowledge of inspections/audits, standard operating procedures, and ISO standards.
Understand Geometric Dimensioning & Tolerancing and cycle counting.

education_certification.credential: High-school diploma or One-year certificate from college or technical school is preferred. 3-5 years of related experience after graduation and/or training.
